intro: Melandrium virginicum, commonly known as the eastern catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. It produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, linear, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
